attributes.action: Convicted rioters should serve out 6 month placements with UK charities and community projects away from home
attributes.additional_details: Instead of imposing jail terms (at further cost to the British tax payer) on those individuals convicted of looting, disorder and damage following the UK riots (9-11 august 2011) the government should send offenders away from their families and home towns (in groups of three) to rural and community projects, and registered charities throughout the UK for a period (up to 6 months) to work for, and be mentored by, persons whose dedication and daily self sacrifice may inspire them to make a different choice in the future.
